abstract: Google will update its privacy policies next month to offer simpler, more transparent language, but a privacy expert worry that the changes are actually bad for consumers.
snippet: Google will update its privacy policies next month to offer simpler, more transparent language, but a privacy expert worry that the changes are actually bad for consumers.
lead_paragraph: It’s no secret that privacy policies on the Web are incomprehensible to most of the public. They’re long, convoluted and contain acronyms and language that require a master’s degree if you want to figure out what the company is doing with your personal information.

headline.main: Google to Simplify Its Privacy Policies

abstract: Google said that the Texas attorney general is conducting an antitrust review on the fairness of Google’s search results.
snippet: Google said that the Texas attorney general is conducting an antitrust review on the fairness of Google’s search results.
lead_paragraph: Updated 5:55 p.m.: Added more information about Microsoft’s connections to the companies that are part of the review.

headline.main: Texas Attorney General Investigates Google Search
